text: So does [[Viashino Heretic]]’s ability actually require the targeted artifact to be destroyed to do the damage? I assume so but thought I’d ask.

attachments.fallback: Viashino Heretic {2}{R} // Creature — Viashino // {1}{R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact. Viashino Heretic deals damage to that artifact's controller equal to the artifact's converted mana cost. // 1/3
attachments.text:
Creature — Viashino
{1}{R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact. Viashino Heretic deals damage to that artifact's controller equal to the artifact's converted mana cost.
_"The past is buried for good reason."_
*1/3*
attachments.title: Viashino Heretic {2}{R}

text: Don’t think it does. There’s usually an “if it’s destroyed this way” rider
If not, seems crazy this doesn’t see more play.
Check that oracle goodness
Let's settle this like nerds
Oracle text is the same
Indeed. “Destroy target artifact. Viashino Heretic deals damage to that artifact's controller equal to the artifact's converted mana cost.”
[[Noxious Gearhulk]]

attachments.fallback: Noxious Gearhulk {4}{B}{B} // Artifact Creature — Construct // Menace // When Noxious Gearhulk enters the battlefield, you may destroy another target creature. If a creature is destroyed this way, you gain life equal to its toughness. // 5/4
attachments.text:
Artifact Creature — Construct
Menace
When Noxious Gearhulk enters the battlefield, you may destroy another target creature. If a creature is destroyed this way, you gain life equal to its toughness.
*5/4*
attachments.title: Noxious Gearhulk {4}{B}{B}

text: Judge Chat agrees. The artifact does NOT need to be destroyed to deal the damage. It just needs to be a legal target.
That seems pretty crazy good.
I was just using it for comparison
It does specify the “if destroyed this way” thing
Right.
I mean, there’s always the Paradox Engine/Isochron Scepter dance to kill anyone with an indestructible artifact. :smiling_imp:
Viashnio Heretic is underplayed as fuck
MVP in Chandler decks
Chandler actually might be playable with Paradox Engine
Gamble is pretty good with daretti and scrap mastery
<https://magic.wizards.com/en/products/unstable/askurza>
Urza's live now
With every planeswalker ability ever apparently
Nice!
Maybe it's just any planeswalker abilities with that activation cost, I was going through th -6 and the gain 100 life ability came up after maybe 10 clicks
Yeah I got Karn's "target player exiles a card from their hands on a plus
Just to reiterate that it could be any PW ability so far as I can tell.
Any ability of that type.
I've put heretic in two of my articles/brews now and he's insane. Also, [[dwarven blastminer]] is crazy good. More people should run him as well.

attachments.fallback: Dwarven Blastminer {1}{R} // Creature — Dwarf // {2}{R}, {T}: Destroy target nonbasic land. // Morph {R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.) // 1/1
attachments.text:

What's this change to patreon that everyone is suddenly raging about?
they are charging a flat % and like .30 cent per transaction
That...sounds like a bad deal for someone with a bunch of $1 patrons
yup

"The crowdfunding platform for artists currently takes a fee of 5% (creators also pay fees charged by payment processors like Stripe or PayPal) from each pledge. That changes on December 18, when patrons will start paying 2.9% plus 35 cents for each individual pledge, according to Patreon’s product update page."
so it looks like they going to get more money per small pledge, less for big pledges

The initial fallout might be really bad, but how sustainable is it?

People threaten to stop playing magic over BS like tuck changes. They don't threaten to quit playing MTG over things like bans.
